title: Carrot Bread Recipe
description: This cakey carrot bread is moist and delicious, bursting with shredded carrots, raisins, flaked coconut, maraschino cherries, and nuts.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Fruits and Vegetables Vegetables Carrots Carrot Bread 4.6 (33) 32 Reviews 14 Photos This carrot bread is really a cross between cake and a quick bread. It's bursting with shredded carrots, raisins, maraschino cherries, and nuts. It's delicious warm with butter or cream cheese for brunch. It's really good! Submitted by PAMSTER2 Updated on March 31, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 20 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 (9x5-inch) loaf Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 2 ½ cups all-purpose flour 1 cup white sugar 1 teaspoon baking powder 1 teaspoon baking soda 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon ½ teaspoon salt 3 large eggs, beaten ½ cup vegetable oil ½ cup milk 2 cups shredded carrots 1 (3.5 ounce) package flaked coconut ½ cup maraschino cherries, chopped ½ cup raisins ½ cup chopped walnuts Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan. Allrecipes / Christina Ma Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl. Allrecipes / Christina Ma Combine eggs, oil, and milk in a separate bowl; stir into flour mixture until well blended. Allrecipes / Christina Ma Stir in carrots, coconut, cherries, raisins, and walnuts. Allrecipes / Christina Ma Pour batter into prepared loaf pan. Allrecipes / Christina Ma Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into center of the loaf comes out clean, about 50 to 60 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to cool completely. Allrecipes / Christina Ma Cook’s Note I store this loaf in an airtight tin or cover with plastic wrap to keep it moist. I Made It Print 60 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 383 Calories 17g Fat 53g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 383 % Daily Value * Total Fat 17g 22% Saturated Fat 5g 25% Cholesterol 47mg 16% Sodium 309mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 53g 19% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 26g Protein 6g 12% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 64mg 5% Iron 2mg 11% Potassium 239mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Carrot Bread 01 of 14 Photo by  Allrecipes / Christina Ma 02 of 14 Photo by  Christine 03/28/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Loved all the fillings in the bread! So much flavor and texture in every bite. 03 of 14 Photo by  Erin Custer 02/27/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite Followed to a “t” and have made multiple times! Always a hit and hubby and work colleagues always ask when I’m making it again! I do add a dash of nutmeg and liquid vanilla for extra flavor and use 3/4 brown sugar and 1/4 white sugar and find that gives it even better flavor whilecutting back on white sugar! A KEEPER!!Thanks for a great recipe! 04 of 14 Photo by  CRRL56GMAILCOM 06/28/2020 05 of 14 Photo by  Timothy Fisher 06/22/2020 06 of 14 Photo by  Bowser 05/05/2020 07 of 14 Photo by  Bowser 05/05/2020 08 of 14 Photo by  timbo 10/20/2019 09 of 14 Photo by  Stuffy Jenks 01/22/2016 10 of 14 Photo by  just_jam 03/01/2015 this was delicious.. i cut the recipe in half and made 12 muffins.. i doubled the cinnamon, used a little more milk (almond) bc the batter seemed a bit dry to me.. i used half a cup of flaked coconut, left out the maraschino cherries and raisins and added 1/4 cup of dried cherries.. i subbed slivered almonds for the walnuts and added 1/2 tsp of almond extract.. SO good.. ty for the recipe 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Basic Fruit Bread Recipe 15 Ratings Vegan Carrot Cake Muffins Healthy Protein Morning Glory Muffins 3 Ratings Carrot Cake Muffins 48 Ratings Hearty Breakfast Muffins 305 Ratings Carrot-Walnut Muffins 3 Ratings Whole Wheat Pumpkin Bread 15 Ratings Better Morning Glory Muffins 72 Ratings Chef John's Zucchini Bread 22 Ratings Cinnamon Carrot Bread 129 Ratings Easy Morning Glory Muffins 1,181 Ratings Gluten-Free Zucchini Muffins Chocolate Zucchini Bread 1,102 Ratings Pumpkin Cranberry Bread 223 Ratings Carrot Pulp Muffins 8 Ratings Carrot Cream Cheese Muffins 11 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
